decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Cultivate and Harrow to get Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle online. Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan are key threats that can take advantage of Valakut's ability to deal damage when Mountains enter the battlefield. Lightning Bolt provides removal while Summoning Trap can cheat out big creatures. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with large creatures and direct damage from Valakut.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through removal spells like Doom Blade and Consuming Vapors, while also using counterspells like Mana Leak to stop threats. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and manipulation, while Mimic Vat allows for recurring powerful creatures like Abyssal Persecutor and Grave Titan. The deck also includes card draw with Sea Gate Oracle and Preordain, as well as land destruction with Tectonic Edge. The strategy is to maintain control of the game until the opponent is overwhelmed by powerful threats and card advantage.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura, along with removal spells like Day of Judgment and Journey to Nowhere. The deck also includes creatures like Baneslayer Angel and Sun Titan to close out the game. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan and gradually taking over the game with card advantage and powerful creatures while keeping the opponent's threats at bay.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Eldrazi Temple in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. The deck also includes cards like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine to control the board and generate value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats early in the game while maintaining control with cards like Tectonic Edge and Mystifying Maze.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers to dominate the battlefield. This is achieved through utilizing cards like Mana Leak, Day of Judgment, and Frost Titan to stall the opponent's threats while generating card advantage with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Preordain. The deck also includes utility cards like Wall of Omens and Ratchet Bomb to handle different types of threats. The win condition is usually through planeswalker ultimate abilities or beating down with creatures like Celestial Colonnade.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's plans while steadily building your own board presence. Using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw, you aim to control the game and outvalue your opponent. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control, while powerful finishers like Grave Titan and Avenger of Zendikar can quickly close out the game. Mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore help you cast your powerful threats ahead of schedule. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the game through control and overwhelming board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck focuses on stalling the opponent's aggression with cards like Wall of Omens and Frost Titan, while also generating card advantage with Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By slowly building up mana and controlling the board with cards like Day of Judgment and Ratchet Bomb, the deck aims to eventually overpower the opponent with powerful finishers like Gideon Jura and Celestial Colonnade. This strategy requires patience and careful decision-making to outlast and outvalue the opponent.

The deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence through efficient creatures like Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn. It utilizes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Gatekeeper of Malakir to clear the way for attacking. Mark of Mutiny can be used to steal opponent's creatures for additional pressure. Viscera Seer provides card selection and sacrifice outlet for Bloodghast. Dark Tutelage and Duress provide card advantage and disruption to control opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and burn spells.

The focus of this deck is to slowly ramp up mana using cards like Harrow, Cultivate, and Khalni Heart Expedition, in order to quickly bring out powerful landfall creatures like Avenger of Zendikar and Primeval Titan. By utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with a high number of Mountains, the deck aims to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's creatures and life total. The deck also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library with cards like Oracle of Mul Daya and Summoning Trap to ensure consistent and effective plays.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Green control deck is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Explore, in order to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. The deck also includes removal spells like All Is Dust and Tectonic Edge to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Primeval Titan and Summoning Trap allow for further mana acceleration and creature recursion. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent with its high-impact threats and control elements.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue and outlast the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually increasing its own advantage through the use of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes threats like Grave Titan and Creeping Tar Pit to close out the game once it has gained control. By efficiently managing resources and denying the opponent key plays, this deck seeks to dominate the battlefield and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By using mana-efficient cards like Lightning Bolt and Molten-Tail Masticore, the deck aims to maintain board control while dealing direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Birds of Paradise and Awakening Zone help ramp up mana production, allowing for explosive plays in the mid to late game. The mixture of creatures with abilities and direct damage spells makes this deck a versatile and formidable opponent in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The primary focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Joraga Treespeaker, Overgrown Battlement, and Eldrazi Temple, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, Kozilek, and Ulamog. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies with cards like All is Dust and Tectonic Edge, while also utilizing cards like Primeval Titan and Wurmcoil Engine to apply pressure. The inclusion of cards like Summoning Trap and Explore helps maintain card advantage, while also allowing for explosive plays.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana and gaining card advantage. It aims to control the board through countering spells, removing threats, and generating value from land drops. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and threats like Avenger of Zendikar and Frost Titan to close out the game. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tumble Magnet to deal with threats. Overall, it aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can win with its finishers.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Overgrown Battlement, Cultivate, and Harrow to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. The goal is to assemble the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle combo with multiple lands in play to deal massive damage to your opponent's creatures and eventually to them directly. Cards like Pyroclasm and Inferno Titan help control the board while you set up your win condition. The deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful late-game threats and combos.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to disrupt your opponent's strategy. By ramping up your mana with cards like Cultivate and Everflowing Chalice, you can quickly play out your high-cost threats like Frost Titan and Primeval Titan. Destructive Force serves as a game-ending finisher, clearing the board of your opponent's creatures while leaving your powerful Titans unscathed. With a mix of card draw and land manipulation, this deck aims to dominate the late game and overwhelm your opponent.
